API/Reference¶

The “lightcurve” module¶

class drwfast.lightcurve.LightCurve(data)¶

A light curve object

errorbar()¶

plot the light curve

structure_function(bins)¶

compute the structure function of the light curve at given time lags

The “model” module¶

class drwfast.model.DRWModel(lc, lnlikefn='PRH')¶

The damped random walk model object

Parameters:lc – A lightcurve object
compute_sigma_level(trace1, trace2, nbins=50)¶

From a set of traces, bin by number of standard deviations

do_map(pinit, set_prior=False)¶

Get the Maximum A Posterior (MAP) DRW parameters.

get_Linf(set_prior=False)¶

Get Likelihood that tau -> infinity.

get_Lnoise(set_prior=False)¶

Get Likelihood that tau -> 0.

lnlike_GP(sigmasqr, tau, lc)¶

Calculate the loglikelihood using standard Gaussian Process method.

lnlike_PRH(sigmasqr, tau, lc, return_chisq=False)¶

Calculate the log-likelihood as laid out in Rybicki/Press 95

lnlike_kalman(sigmasqr, tau, lc)¶

Calculate the loglikelihood using the Kalman fitler method.

plot_MCMC_trace(ax, trace, scatter=False, **kwargs)¶

Plot traces and contours

class drwfast.model.SupOUModel(lc, lnlikefn='PRH')¶

The damped random walk model object

Parameters:lc – A lightcurve object
do_map(pinit, set_prior=False)¶

Get the Maximum A Posterior (MAP) DRW parameters.

lnlike_PRH(sigmasqr, tau_H, lc, return_chisq=False)¶

Calculate the log-likelihood as laid out in Rybicki/Press 95

set_weights(lc, tau_H, alpha, M=30)¶

Calculate the weights of the individual OU processes.

drwfast.model.lnlike_Kalman_fast¶

Calculate the DRW loglikelihood using the Kalman Filter Method.

Note: numba is used for speed, but can’t be used for methods so the DRWModel method lnlike_kalman calls this function.
